meanings.definition: An instrument used to measure electric charge.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a coulometer to check the amount of electric charge in the battery.
meanings.sent2: The coulometer displayed the exact measurement of the electric charge in the circuit.
meanings.sent3: When the coulometer beeped, it was like a tiny robot announcing the amount of electric charge.
meanings.sent4: The coulometer was a silent observer, revealing the secrets of electric charge.
meanings.sent5: With a coulometer in hand, the student could see the invisible world of electric charge.

meanings.definition: A device that measures the quantity of electricity passed through it.
meanings.sent1: The coulometer recorded the total electricity that flowed through the circuit.
meanings.sent2: Every laboratory needs a reliable coulometer to measure electricity accurately.
meanings.sent3: The coulometer seemed to have a magical ability to count the electricity passing through it.
meanings.sent4: The coulometer was like a diligent accountant, keeping track of every unit of electricity.
meanings.sent5: Using the coulometer felt like holding the power of electricity in the palm of your hand.
